cause.description:
In-School Tutoring Program
The Treehouse In-School Tutoring program provides one-on-one educational assistance for students in specific Seattle schools. Treehouse Tutors are certified teachers who help students improve their basic skill levels, provide homework assistance, and develop positive school-related behaviors. They also act as advocates for students with school staff and families.
Treehouse Learning Centers The Treehouse Learning Centers provide after-school homework and remediation help to youth in middle school and high school.
Coaching-to-College Middle School Program The Coaching-to-College Middle School Program offers ongoing workshops to groups of middle school youth. The workshops help youth think about their career and education plans, and what they can be doing now to help reach their goals.
Coaching-to-College High School Program The Coaching-to-College High School Program trains volunteers from the community as Coaches to support youth through high school graduation/GED completion, and as they continue on with their education.
Educational Advocacy Program The Treehouse Educational Advocacy Program places advocates in DCFS offices around the state to work directly with social workers, youth and families to resolve educational issues. Educational Advocates help youth access extra services at school, reduce suspensions and expulsions, stay in the same school when there is a home move and more.
1. Foster kids deserve the same education as other kids.
cause.mission: Giving foster kids a childhood... and a future.
cause.name: Education Fund
